intro: Conostylis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense umbel, typical of the family. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Conostylis angustifolia is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained environments.
